intro: Buchnera floridana, commonly known as the Florida Buchnera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Buchnera floridana is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
